lines.text: [Television agent Harry Bayliss asks Eddy about how he learned to sing]
Call that singin'? That was nuthin'.
Eddy learned hisself ta sing, didn't cha, Eddy?
Shut up, Iris.
[Eddy brings his gang into Bayliss's office, where they meet with TV station manager Ray Morrissey]
Are you the guy's who's gonna put Eddy on the TV?
Well, I don't know, miss. Eh, we came down to hear him sing. If he's anything like, uh...
Oh, come *on*, pop! Eddy can sing rings around any of 'em! He can sing better than any of 'em -
Shut up, Iris.
But I just wanted -
You hear what I said?
[Moon and the gang want Eddy to party down, but the TV folks advise abstention]
There'll be plenty of time to celebrate later on. You could catch cold or something.
What're you, his mother?
I didn't -
Iris!
[At the hotel, the gang parties, but Eddy is in a somber mood]
...the matter, man? Why don't you join the party? What's the matter, you afraid you might be catchin' a cold, man?
Maybe you just wanna be with that freako nuthin' you've been makin' eyes with, huh?
Get off my back, Iris. I'm thinkin'.
[the nebbish hotel manager, complaining about the gang's behavior, gets mocked for his trouble]
Whyyyy, you young hoodlums, I'll call the police!
You say one word to anyone and I'm gonna *moon* you.
You're gonna what?
MOON YOU!
